definition: to get there in one step (idiom); easily done/success at a stroke/to get results overnight
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
variant of 蹴[cu4]
carefully/to kick/to tread on/to stamp
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: The move toward worldwide peace and prosperity is a marathon, not a sprint.
sentences.chinese: 通往全球和平和繁荣之路是漫长的，不能一蹴而就。

sentences.english: The world must recognise that China can adjust, but it cannot adjust immediately.
sentences.chinese: 世界必须认识到，中国能够调整，但不可能一蹴而就。

sentences.english: For many of these entrepreneurs, success didn't happen overnight. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 对于其中许多创业者而言，成功并非一蹴而就的。

sentences.english: For many of these entrepreneurs, success didn`t happen overnight.
sentences.chinese: 对于许多创业者而言，成功并非一蹴而就。

sentences.english: Fighting corruption is a long-term commitment, and results will not come overnight.
sentences.chinese: 与腐败作斗争是一项长期的承诺，不能一蹴而就。

sentences.english: He understands that this ultimate goal will not be reached quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他了解实现这个最终目标不可能一蹴而就。

sentences.english: He knew that he could not transform society by one bugle blast.
sentences.chinese: 他知道，改造社会不能一蹴而就。

sentences.english: Systemic journalistic change will require societal change, and that will not happen overnight.
sentences.chinese: 新闻业的系统化改变要求社会变革，不可一蹴而就。

definition: lit. one morning and one evening (idiom)/fig. in a short period of time/overnight
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
variant of 蹴[cu4]
carefully/to kick/to tread on/to stamp
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
to accomplish the whole task at one stroke (idiom)
pinyin: bi4 qi2 gong1 yu2 yi1 yi4

definition: take your time/take it easy
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: to pursue unremittingly (idiom); to persevere
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: course of events/process/CL:個|个[ge4]
inevitable outcome/inescapable consequence
to accumulate/accumulation/cumulative/cumulatively
lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
